How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around un

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.

I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than so

I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes.

I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors an

I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting relationships.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think socai

Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships is

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've s

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen it have the effect of causing peopl

I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to com

Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relat

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what

I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the

Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the good, so a false reality co

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the good, so a false reality could be derived if you thoug

I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the good, so a false reality could be derived if you thought soci

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the good, so a false reality could be d

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the good, so people who feel insecure might get a fal

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the good, so people who feel insecure might get a false sense that other relationships are better than t

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the good, so people who feel insecure might get a false sense that other relationships are better than theirs. It really can become a tangled web. In su

I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the good, so people who feel insecure might get a false sense that other relationships are better than theirs. It really can become a tangled web. In sum, no, I don't think new

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory. The final reason I think social media is harmful to relationships and dating is that it makes people hyper aware of other people's experiences and relationships. I've seen people use it to compare their relationships with others'. No relationship is perfect but what gets posted is usually the good, so people who feel insecure might get a false sense that other relationships are better than theirs. It really can become a tangled web. In sum, no, I don't think social media, in par

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, technology can have a bad effect on dating, particularly social media. For one, it makes it easier for people to falsely portray themselves. Instead of focusing on getting to know other people at a deep level, social media has a tendency to encourage people to focus on their own image of surface level appearances and experiences. I think this contributes to unhealthy comparisons between people, which can lead to insecurity and all around unhealthy ways of relating to people. lso, social media makes it easier for people to treat relationships as a commodity.
 It is so often I see people jump from one relationship to the next quickly, each time making a big announcement with photos galore. It seems like it's more about the image they are trying to portray with these than something more authentic. Sometimes. I just don't think these behaviors and ways of thinking are conducive to a good healthy relationship. art of relationship success, in my opinion, comes from deeper lasting rbonds with people that aren't flaunted like a new accessory.
